node.display_long_description:
“This is the kind of social videogame Oculus Quest was made for.” - VRFocus
“... offers up everything that I could ask for in an immersive VR experience." - 
TheGamer

**Holiday Update! Ho-ho-hold the lettuce & pass the turkey & mashed potatoes! 

Resolution Games has cooked up a new casual mode for virtual chefs to take a break from the wild kitchen & cook up meals at their leisure… & for special guests. For a limited time, casual mode will have the halls decked as a wintry wonderland, delicious holiday recipes, & even a special visit from Santa! So come join us before the snow melts!**

Set within the cook’s cabin of a fairytale forest, Cook-Out: A Sandwich Tale is a wacky & whimsical adventure that challenges up to four players (single mode available) to work together to keep the orders coming for a hungry cast of enchanted creatures in this multiplayer VR title.

So put on your aprons… things are about to get messy!

nodes.title: Holiday update – new game mode and other festivities!
nodes.body_text:
Ho-ho-hold the lettuce and pass the turkey and mashed potatoes! The jolliest update of the season is now available. Check out the new creative mode where you can make any sandwiches you want and serve them to Santa and the reindeer, earn the festive rewards and find the hidden recipes!

- New Ingredients: What would the holidays be without turkey, candy canes, mashed potatoes, and a gingerbread house?
- New Characters: Santa knows how to keep warm (he’s a Polar Bear, after all), and so do his reindeer in their tacky Christmas sweaters
- New Environment: Your favorite village will feature snow, decorations, and more to bring the holidays to life -- including a few indoor decorations in your own kitchen
- Surprises: If you’ve been really good this year, Santa just might leave a new cleaver, cutting board, or fridge under your tree. And if you look carefully, there might even be some sandwich recipes for you to discover
Oculus Quest 2 improvements: We’ve added better graphics, refresh rate and assets for the new headset.

Additional bug fixes and updates have also been made to  the game.

We hope you enjoy the new updates. Happy holidays from all of us at Resolution Games!

nodes.title: Cook-Out: A Sandwich Tale v1.2 released
nodes.body_text:
We've updated the game with several updates and bug fixes.

Game changes:
- Added a button on the wrist menu to toggle a multiplayer room between being private and public.
- Player name is now displayed above each avatar, including who is the current host of the game.
- Added button in the wrist menu to allow to end a round. This is possible in regular levels, endless mode and the tutorial. This can be either done in single player or when you are a host in multiplayer.
- Added leaderboard support for the Endless Mode.
- Added new game hints.
- Added new spawn points for the Radish Dude.

Fixes:
- Fixed bug that caused rewards in endless mode to not unlock properly. Save files affected by this should be automatically restored after installing the update.
- Fixed bug that allowed the story voice over to play over itself.
- Updated the world map to make it clearer how to use it. Also added tooltip on how to replay levels on the map.
- Rebalanced a couple of early levels that were harder than intended.
- Fixed bug that made it far too easy to knock off newly sliced ingredients off the table
- Minor stability fixes.

node.reviewDescription:
I never write reviews, I’m the guy who sees a prompt to “Review our app on our store!” and close that instantly with a mild and humble 2 percent increase in annoyance that it’s being shoved in my face. This game is phenomenal. But not only that, The Devs and the entire team? They are the true stars here, Right up there? Those 5 stars? Those are the team for this game. Cook-Out is such an excellent VR experience and a challenging feat as well, you’ll be replaying levels chasing 3 stars and it has excellent incentive too! 

You are rewarded with a generous amount of skins and customizable cleavers and cutting boards and fridges and they are all lovingly modeled and all have charm and class. Finding a good team of chefs and then tackling on levels bestows a sense of having comrades and a genuine bond for a fleeting moment and those are the moments you take home with you but oh no, this review doesn’t stop there. 

Outside the game and in the Discord server? I have NEVER seen and interacted with such amazing people on the team of this game. Every one of the members on the team cares. Genuinely cares about this project, This game and most of all, it’s players. I always feel daunted and like I should keep to myself around people like developers, they have enough work to deal with, they don’t have time to check in on things. Not this team, oh not at all. You have an idea? Pitch it to them and you get a response back, something wrong in your game? Let em know and they are personally made aware of it and best of all they mingle with the players too and it’s just a breath of fresh air to see love given from players and returned back ten fold from them and letting you know that your voice is heard. Pick up this game and join the Discord too, Be apart of a community that cares about its game and you!
node.reviewTitle: Serving up love in and out of game!
